eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age and Gender
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Males and non-pregnant, non-lactating females between 18 - 80 years of age inclusive, based on the date of the Screening visit

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: NASH and Fibrosis Diagnosis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Bridging fibrosis or cirrhosis due to NASH as defined by one of the following; all subjects must not have documented weight loss > 5% between the date of the biopsy and Screening: a) NASH (defined as the presence of a steatosis grade ≥1, hepatocellular ballooning grade ≥ 1, and lobular inflammation grade ≥ 1, according to the nonalcoholic fatty liver disease [NAFLD] Activity Score [NAS]) and bridging fibrosis (F3) within 6 months of Screening, in the opinion of the central reader; b) Compensated cirrhosis (F4) due to NASH (defined as the presence of a steatosis grade ≥ 1, hepatocellular ballooning grade ≥ 1, and lobular inflammation grade ≥ 1, according to the NAS) within 12 months of Screening, in the opinion of the central reader; c) Compensated cirrhosis (F4) due to NASH with < 5% steatosis (defined as a steatosis grade of 0, hepatocellular ballooning grade ≥ 1, and lobular inflammation grade ≥ 1, according to the NAS) within 12 months of Screening, in the opinion of the central reader; and at least two of the following criteria for metabolic syndrome, modified from the National Cholesterol Education Program Adult Treatment Plan III {Grundy 2005} Guidelines at Screening: i. Fasting glucose ≥100 mg/dL or receiving drug treatment for elevated glucose; ii. Fasting HDL cholesterol < 40 mg/dL in men and < 50 mg/dL in women or receiving drug treatment for low HDL cholesterol; iii. Fasting triglycerides ≥ 150 mg/dL or receiving drug treatment for elevated triglycerides; iv. Waist circumference ≥102 cm for men or ≥88 cm for women or BMI ≥ 30 kg/m2; v. Systolic blood pressure ≥130 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure ≥ 85 mmHg or receiving drug treatment for hypertension; d) In subjects who have never had a liver biopsy, liver stiffness by FibroScan® XL probe ≥ 14.0 kPa, Enhanced Liver Fibrosis (ELF™) Test score ≥9.8, and at least two of the criteria for metabolic syndrome modified from the NCEP ATP III Guidelines, at Screening. In subjects eligible based on this criterion, a liver biopsy must be performed during Screening and must be deemed evaluable for fibrosis stage and NAS by the central reader; however, the reported stage of fibrosis will not determine eligibility for the study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Screening Laboratory Parameters
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Screening laboratory parameters, as determined by the central laboratory: a) Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60 mL/min, as calculated by the Cockcroft-Gault equation; b) HbA1c ≤ 9.5% (or serum fructosamine ≤381 µmol if HbA1c is unable to be resulted); c) Hemoglobin ≥ 10.6 g/dL; d) International normalized ratio (INR) ≤ 1.4, unless due to therapeutic anticoagulation; e) Total bilirubin ≤ 1.3 x upper limit of normal (ULN), unless due to an alternate etiology such as Gilbert’s syndrome or hemolytic anemia; f) Platelet count ≥ 125,000/µL; g) Serum triglyceride level ≤ 250 mg/dL; h) Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) < 5 x ULN.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Decompensated Liver Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Prior history of decompensated liver disease including ascites, hepatic encephalopathy (HE), or variceal bleeding

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Child-Pugh Score
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: CP score > 6 at Screening, unless due to an alternative etiology such as Gilbert’s syndrome or therapeutic anticoagulation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: MELD Score
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) score > 12 at Screening, unless due to an alternate etiology such as therapeutic anticoagulation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HBV Infection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection (hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] positive)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HCV Infection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection (HCV antibody [Ab] and HCV ribonucleic acid [RNA] positive). Subjects cured of HCV infection less than 2 years prior to the Screening visit are not eligible

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other Liver Diseases
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Other causes of liver disease based on medical history and/or centralized review of liver histology, including but not limited to: alcoholic liver disease, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, autoimmune disorders (eg, primary biliary cholangitis [PBC], primary sclerosing cholangitis [PSC], autoimmune hepatitis), drug-induced hepatotoxicity, Wilson disease, clinically significant iron overload, or alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency requiring treatment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Liver Transplantation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of liver transplantation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hepatocellular Carcinoma
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Current or prior history of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Weight Reduction Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any weight reduction surgery within 2 years prior to Screening or malabsorptive weight loss surgery (eg, Roux-en-Y or distal gastric bypass) at any time prior to Screening. Weight reduction surgery is disallowed during the study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Intestinal Resection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Intestinal resection that could result in malabsorption of study drug

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent Weight Loss
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Weight loss > 10% within 6 months of Screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HIV Infection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Unstable Cardiovascular Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Unstable cardiovascular disease
